name: biz formal
look_1_tip: Pant suits look good if they are the right length.  The hem should hit anywhere between your ankle bone and the middle of your high heel.
look_2_tip: Wear a shell or nice tank top under the blazer for simplicity.  Skirts look best when the hem hits at or below the knee.
look_3_tip: Wear darker color dresses for conservative offices, but don't shy away from a spash of color for more festive occasions.
tip: Biz Formal is about dressing to impress.  Blazers are you friend in this dress code and so are darker, muted colors.  Always make sure to cover more and not less.

name: biz casual
look_1_tip: Pencil skirts are a staple in any biz casual closet.  Pair with a blouse, sweater, or cute top.
look_2_tip: Tuck in your shirt for a more formal look and leave it untucked for a more casual occasion.
look_3_tip: Casual dresses are usually made of less structured material and more flowy than biz formal.
tip: Biz Casual is for the day to day.  Button down blouses, cardigans, skirts, and trousers are a closet staple. Skip the blazer and you'll be on your way.

name: smart casual
look_1_tip: Smart casual still includes cute dresses that are just a little less formal.
look_2_tip: Wear cardigans to ward off the chills in the office and stay comfortable.
look_3_tip: Sweater and jeans are great for Casual Fridays, just make sure your jeans don't have holes in them!
tip: Smart Casual is for the more laid back days at work.  Here is where you can bring out the brigher colors and patterns.  Jeans are a smart option to find comfort and casual.

name: tech casual
look_1_tip: Jeans plus a soft comfy T are the perfect combo for the everyday tech scene.
look_2_tip: Weather proof jackets are your best friend.  They guard against office chills and unexpected sprinkles.
look_3_tip: If you're commuting or biking to work, there's no shame in rolling up in athletic pants.  Versatility is encouraged so that you can also hit the gym on your way home.
